Cafeteria permanently closed, restaurants closed (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday...). Nice pool with bar (bar very expensive). Bread service was offered but didn't take place the next morning. In this condition, the place is only suitable for transit as a self-catering.

The town is 4 km away and has all the services (pharmacies, bakeries, bars, tobacconists, grocery stores, banks). The environment is surrounded by olive and almond trees.

title: (13250) Daimiel - 30 Paseo Carmen

Sale of butane and propane, firewood and biomass. It has a free shower for guests and a cafeteria. Very clean bathrooms with breastfeeding area. Shop with local products. The owner has another low cost gas station next to this one with great fuel discounts and a wash area. You can park and sleep without problem in one of its esplanades.

title: (13005) Ciudad Real - P-2112

title: (13431) Villar del Pozo - Unnamed road
description: Streets without buildings, there is no traffic, a spacious and safe place, there is no shade, a stream runs nearby, the airport is for logistics use. Perfect place to let your dog loose.

title: (13250) Daimiel - Unnamed Road

title: (13195) Valverde -

The parking lot is quiet with plenty of shade, there is a water fountain nearby and toilets, which are occasionally open... impressive views of both the castle and De la Vega of the Guadiana river, nearby are hiking trails to Valverde and its lagoon for example! A good place to spend the night, we went in the van, and everything was perfect.

It is only open in summer to cross the strait, a pity that it is not open all year.

description: A picnic / rest area with a pond, very quiet and pleasant. There is 4g network and the city is not far. There are free services and tables under the trees.

title: (13300) El Peral - CR-6441
description: A little hill with enough space to park a few medium sized vans. At the time of writing this only one other small car was parked here. beautiful view, very quiet and peaceful. no prohibition signs, no amenities. supposedly open 24h. spend one night without any problems. you can hear the highway in the distance. no shade

title: (13247) San Carlos del Valle -
description: Picnic place to rest and possibility to spend the night. Wonderful views during the day, but especially at night towards the illuminated church. There is not a lot of parking space and it is slightly incline, but it is always empty and very quiet. There are picnic tables and trash cans.

title: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 9 Camino Altillo

title_short: (13240) La Solana - 5 Avenida de la Paz
description: La Solana motorhome area, area with very spacious pitches, well leveled and with shaded areas. It has all the services, including bathrooms with showers. Of course, there is a charge for the zone and each service is chargeable apart from the night service. Located in a park, 10 minutes walk from the center. Perfect to spend a night, discover the city, buy La Mancha products. Good area near (30 km) from the natural park of Las Lagunas de Ruidera.

title: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 86 Avenida del Azuer
title_short: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 86 Avenida del Azuer

title_short: (13679) Arenas de San Juan - 2T Calle Cervantes

title: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 28 Calle Colón
title_short: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 28 Calle Colón
description: Fresh drinking water fountain on the wall of number 38 Calle Colón.

title: (13738) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 62 Poblado Nuestra Señora de las Vir
title_short: (13738) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 62 Poblado Nuestra Señora de las Vir
description: Large quiet gravel parking lot in Las Virtudes. Picnic area in a shaded corner. Great countryside views. A few steps from the 17th century bullring. Attached to the 15th century church. Toilets in front of the arenas. Also not far from Bodegas Cañaveras in Santa Cruz de Mudela - a beautiful family winery that still uses giant original clay pots. Worth a visit. After the park next to the bullring there is a source of drinking water. While there is no sign, the gentleman from the arena told us so and we saw locals getting their water supply there.

address.street: 62 Poblado Nuestra Señora de las Vir

title: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 5 Camino Senda Galvarin
title_short: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 5 Camino Senda Galvarin
description: Quiet place to sleep to the outside of town. Well paved and no problem to park.

title: (13100) Piedrabuena -
description: Super nice place to quietly experience the sunset and sunrise. There is space for 5 campers with lots of open space. Ideal place for a hike. A few meters up the mountain there is a small church with a great view of the valley and the village. Please always take your rubbish with you, or put it in a rubbish bin like here.

title: (13500) Puertollano - 4 Carretera Pozo Norte
description: It is a parking lot of the mining museum, we had a great night here. Very cool this morning 1 degrees outside. The city is to be visited by going around the Park. The museum is currently closed.

title: (13247) San Carlos del Valle - 11 CR-644
description: Place away from the town of San Carlos del Valle next to the hermitage of San Isidro, a very very quiet place to spend the night. surrounded by a pine forest to walk. There is water inside the enclosure with a tap, next to the barbecues.

title: (13240) La Solana - 29 Calle Soledad
description: Automatic laundry with many washing machines including machines for washing pet accessories, it has free wifi, change machine, coffee machine and spreader.

title: (13300) Valdepeñas - Unnamed Road
description: Nice place to sleep with a view and silence. Walking route 'routa de Don Quijote' around the corner. At 500m from the public road, but very well accessible dirt road.

title: (13597) Puertollano - N-420
description: Next to the road nice park near the village, to stop with dirt parking, flat. Without services

title: (13300) Valdepeñas - Unnamed Road
description: Beside the lake with a view towards the hills opposite, peaceful. No camping prohibition signs, sign that prohibits swimming and fishing, there's a kayak centre not far from here. Lovely walks, used by the locals, lots of toilet paper about but I cleaned it all so nature restored. No services, bin close by.  Follow the paved road to the dam wall, the access road is on the left before the dam wall it is a single narrow dirt track for about 100m with a few overhanging trees but we made it in our 7m long, 3m high camper

title: (13390) Pozo de la Serna - 1 Carretera Infantes P
title_short: (13390) Pozo de la Serna - 1 Carretera Infantes P

title_short: (13770) Viso del Marqués - 11 Paseo de Canalejas

title: (13580) Almodóvar del Campo - Unnamed Road
description: The Almodovar mill of Don Quijot y Sancho Just at the top of the village not overlooked, overlooking the plain and part of the city Puertollano the road below about 300 m from the spot very light traffic

title: (13597) Puertollano - Unnamed Road

Start for mountain biking and hiking routes. It is located at the gates of the Valle de Alcudia and Sierra Madrona Natural Park. All services are price paid at an ATM.

title: (13770) Viso del Marqués -

Our van is small and we crossed the dam that there is another esplanade and the dust from the road where you arrive does not reach you because the odd vehicle passes by during the day. At night one last.

title_short: (13770) Viso del Marqués - Camino de las Alcobillas

title: (13592) Mestanza - 13D Calle la Fuente M
description: Parking near a public park, next to a covered track that is used for the town festivals, there is no sign that prevents parking, a street with very little traffic, there is a water tap and garbage cans, a small park for children's games and a football field. The surroundings of Mestanza have a very interesting landscape, especially in spring and autumn.

title: (13210) Villarta de San Juan - Autovía del Sur
title_short: (13210) Villarta de San Juan - Autovía del Sur
description: Impossible to sleep here because of the noise from the highway. however it is a wonderful shady spot and the pool in summer is glorious.

title: (13760) Almuradiel -
description: After the parking lot of the restaurant and the trucks there is a wide flat area with tables and benches with plenty of trees. Quiet place where we spent the night.

title: (13592) Mestanza - 22 Calle del Charco M
description: Place to spend a night even being parked during the day because the town is very narrow and there is no place to be able to get better as it is a very quiet place there is no problem

title: (13760) Almuradiel - Camino al Pantano de Almuradiel
title_short: (13760) Almuradiel - Camino al Pantano de Almuradiel
description: Nice pitch with kids. Sit around the back seat around a fence. They can't leave. There are picnic benches/tables, there are 10 BBQ's with shade, there is water. Toilet drain not recognized / clogged. Quiet at night and during the day, except for a single noisy train right next to it behind the fence.

title: (13210) Villarta de San Juan - Autovía del Sur
title_short: (13210) Villarta de San Juan - Autovía del Sur
description: Motorway rest area, both directions. Close to the road, no barrier or vegetation between the picknicktables and the road. Decent view. No shade, no services (only bins).

title: (13650) Puerto Lápice - Autovía del Sur
description: Next to a gas station, a little noisy by the passage of trucks but sure.

title: (13650) Puerto Lápice - 140 A-4
description: Gas station and rest area La Pausa. Shower possible, usually for a small fee.

title: (45710) Madridejos - Unnamed Road
description: Wide esplanade many spaces between the pines to be in the shade. usual picnic area and camping allowed. There are several very good routes through the Valdehierro mountain range. Total silence during the night. There is a very interesting nature classroom. You arrive from the Madridejos, you have to pass the bridge over the highway and continue.

title: (13650) Puerto Lápice - 58 Calle Calatrava
description: New municipal motorhome area of Puerto Lapice, next to the civil guard, with all services, within the town, 5 minutes walk from the square, views of the mills and the beginning of the route to visit the hermitage of San Isidro, several bike routes, and walking you can go up to the mills, from where you can see the entire region of la mancha.

title: (13594) Solanilla del Tamaral -
description: Nice location along a quiet road and one of the few suitable locations in this area to stay in your vehicle. along running water against a slope where the red deer and mountain goats come to eat in the evening and morning. no facilities and no internet coverage.

title: (13650) Puerto Lápice - 2 Calle Sierrecilla
description: Free service area. Caterer and shops 500 m away, in the center of the village. Easy access because well indicated by signs. View of the Mills. Be careful with clean water tap on the left when entering the area.

title: (13650) Puerto Lápice - Unnamed Road
description: Place near the mills of Puerto Lapice, about 300m approximately, the place is fairly well leveled, the views are magnificent, in the town there is a gas station and it is near, without limit of height and width by the access road to the place circulates agricultural machinery, a perfect place to stop in your travels

title: (45480) Urda -
description: Old picnic area with flat surfaces. Very quiet. Some trees provide shade. tables and benches.
